name: Early-demographic dividend
special_notes: Early-dividend countries are mostly lower-middle-income countries further along the fertility transition. Fertility rates have fallen below four births per woman and the working-age share of the population is likely rising considerably.

name: Post-demographic dividend
special_notes: Post-dividend countries are mostly high-income countries where fertility has transitioned below replacement levels.

name: Pre-demographic dividend
special_notes: Pre-dividend countries are mostly low-income countries, lagging in key human development indicators and with current fertility levels above four births per woman. They face very rapid population growth.
